w:HTMLPanel.title: PWT - Tutorial Part 2 - Build the Welcome Page

w:HTMLPanel.p: In this tutorial, we will will add a static welcome page to the project inited in Part 1 : Init a PWT project
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 1 : Ensure the Module XML configuration
w:HTMLPanel.p: In order to use the PWT's widgets and MVP features, the module XML file must containe the following :

c:StaticCode.pre: <!-- PWT Module to extends in order to use PWT widgets--> <inherits name="fr.putnami.pwt.core.widget.Widget"/> <!-- PWT Module to extends in order to use PWT MVP features--> <inherits name="fr.putnami.pwt.core.mvp.Mvp"/>

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 2 : Create the Place
w:HTMLPanel.p: To create a place, you have to extends ViewPlace and add the annotation @ActivityDescription. The view declared must at least implement IsWidget.

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 3 : Declare the activity
w:HTMLPanel.p: We have some configurations to do in the application entry point.
First of all, we have to define the display associated with the ActivityManager and add it to the RootPanel. Then we have to Register the new place WelcomePlace and set it as default.
To do that, We will use the annotation based configuration. Our entry point has now to implements the Module interface.
Don't forget to add the dependency to the Inject module in the Module xml file (here the fr/putnami/pwt/tutorial/Tutorial.gwt.xml) :

c:StaticCode.pre: <!-- PWT Module to extends in order to use PWT Inject features--> <inherits name="fr.putnami.pwt.core.inject.Inject"/>

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 5 : Test the app
w:HTMLPanel.p: In order to run the app in draft compile mode, use

To run it in production mode, use
